body_html:
Careful: if you only consider the first variable found in an iterable or mapping, the backward hook won't be registered for the rest!

Also, you might want to use the collections interface to determine whether something is list-like or dict-like (example).
body_text:
Careful: if you only consider the first variable found in an iterable or mapping, the backward hook won't be registered for the rest!
Also, you might want to use the collections interface to determine whether something is list-like or dict-like (example).
body:
Careful: if you only consider the first variable found in an iterable or mapping, the backward hook [won't be registered for the rest](https://github.com/amirsaffari/pytorch/blob/ae15998304815a52918889eb63d588eae2e7e10e/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L225)!

Also, you might want to use the collections interface to determine whether something is list-like or dict-like ([example](https://github.com/nhynes/pytorch/blob/0033fd4163be0b044cac0b348430978f4c9451d8/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py#L75)).
